original_sentence: In particular, we advocate creating these joint models as conditional random fields (CRFs) (Lafferty et al., 2001) that have been configured to represent relational data by using parameter tying in repeated patterns based on the structure of the data—also known as relational Markov networks (Taskar et al., 2002).

relational Markov networks

original_sentence: To address this problem we have previously advocated (McCallum & Jensen, 2003) the use of joint probabilistic models that perform extraction and data mining in an integrated inference procedure—the evidence for an outcome being the result of simultaneously making inferences both “bottom up” from extraction, and  autocorrelation and other relations without concern for avoiding circularities (Taskar et al., 2002; Nevillle et al., 2004).

original_sentence: Using a data set of citations from CiteSeer (Lawrence et al., 1999), we present experimental results indicating that the type of integration we advocate does indeed hold promise—we show that modeling uncertainty about extraction of citation fields can improve coreference (in the face of different field orderings, abbreviations and typographic errors), and that leveraging predicted coreference can improve the extraction accuracy of these fields.
